poem:
**Crossed Words**

Lifting ink from the page,  
boxed in by squares, whispers  
shuffle through breakfast steam.  
Clues meet their answers,    
stripped bare in the daylight,  
anagrams as architecture,  
syllables click into place –  
a clever arrangement,  
shaded with misdirection.  
Eyebrows arch in triumphant  
third acts, mysteries solved,  
the world suddenly neat,  
reduced to gridded simplicity.
